This is a great place to stay if you have to be out of your house for 5 days when the pipes are being epoxy. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for our family of 6. We felt like we were right at home. Excellent staff and great facility.

clean, great breakfast and nice pool.  Great area and many restaurants available nearby.  San Juan Capistrano 15 minutes away which is a plus.  Great weather close to ocean.  Sheets were a little rough not soft and it made them itchy.  Kitchen has everything and that was a plus.  They also have some microwavable food down in the lobby store for a midnight snack

we waited 2 hours at the lobby because other vip or diamond member took late check out.  That was the explain from the hotel  that we arrived at 3pm and got our rooms at 5 pm.  the front manager even did not tell us waiting time.  we asked when, he answered 'rooms are not ready' I had group of 30 people.   worst experience

Efficient suites. Pool Area is great with a fire pit area adjacent that is spectacular. The breakfast area lacks enough room for the crowd. The adjacent construction blocks the road which is on GPS. Got a nail in tire.

I will likely stay here again. It was a good location, for the purpose of my trip. Place was clean, staff was friendly and willing to help or answer questions. I really have nothing bad to say about this place.

The hotel was clean and very nice. The kids enjoyed the pool, close to family in the area, and shopping stores down the street. If in the area again, I will stay at this hotel again. I recommend this hotel, the location was perfect, clean the area was safe and enjoyable.

We stayed here for a full week in a one bedroom suite.  Since the hotel was only about a 1/2 year old, we figured it would be clean and tidy, but the staff would probably be a little green.  Check in was perfect and quick, but we didn't try to check in early, some people were hanging around the lobby at 3:00 waiting for their rooms to be ready.  And check in is after 3.  We had a lovely room, large, clean, suitable for 4 but there were only two of us.  The bathroom is connected to the Master Bedroom and you have to walk through the bedroom to get to it.  So, if there are guests staying in the living room, they would have to go through the bedroom.  The furnishings were great.  The only negative is the view.  There is construction everywhere around there and our room happened to

yes this is a wonderful place to stay and they certainly want to make you feel at home.  The front desk staff is so friendly and accommodating, the breakfast is fresh and full of variety.  The housekeeping staff is genuine and cares about the comfort of the guest.  The room was impeccable and I definitely felt right at home.  Always happy to stay at this hotel.

I stayed here with my family (wife, 4yr old, and 6yr old) while on vacation. We chose this location due to its proximity to other relatives. Upon entering the lobby, you get a sense of modernness and class. This motif extends into the suites, which, not only looked nice, but was also well-equipped and well-suited for me and my family. The kitchenette, (which had a full-size fridge!) was great for preparing some simple meals and snacks. The charging cables built into the nightstand and the USB charging ports in the lamps were indicative of how this brand understands the modern traveler's needs. The suites were nice and spacious, and was a great fit for our family. The only thing I felt was lacking was the availability of restaurants in the immediate area. There are plenty within

Summary Heading: Lauren, the team and this hotel are terrific
Summary: The hotel is about 20 minutes away from my office.  I have regularly stayed in a hotel less than 5 minutes away from my office.  I was encouraged to contact Lauren to give this hotel a try.  It was great advice.  Great service and a great stay.  I will be back.

I travel 45% of the year for business.  I can say that this hotel definitely stood out to me.   First, while it doesnt sit on the freeway exit, it is quickly accessed in a minute or so.  Unfortunately there is a bunch of construction in the area, it can be heard in the morning, however this is not the fault of the hotel and should be over soon.  Actually, my fear is that when it is over, the price per night may increase and I'll be priced out!!   Anyway, back to my review the staff is friendly, and it seems to be because they are friendly people, not because they have to for their job.    Free breakfast and hosted snacks with beer and wine, and super close to a movie theater, Trader Joes, mulple restauants.... The list goes on.    Check it out!

Summary Heading: OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE PERFECT FOR FAMILYS !!!
Summary: we stayed at this hotel for a little 5 day family beach getaway the hotel is clean smells new and the hotel staff is #1 i would promise from the time you enter to the time you leave the customer service will be AA++ the rooms and pool are very nice and clean and breakfast in the am and free parking and about 15 min from the beach tons of shopping within a 5 min or less drive why stay anywhere else Keno the manager helped us at checkin and i would almost guarantee your stay will be perfect!

We were very happy with our stay at this hotel! It was very clean, they have a nice complimentary breakfast, the staff is very friendly and accomidating and my favorite part was the full size kitchen! We will definitley be staying here again!

Summary Heading: Best experience .... Homewood suites raising the bar
Summary: I've been to many Homewood suites and it's always the same outstanding experience ... No complain  what so ever. I will keep staying in homewood suites in the near future. Love the mini studio look, kitchen, room, etc.

Nice stay. Arrived late. They had the room ready. Constant humming noise from the bathroom. Carpet seem from bathroom to bedroom was in need of repair. Otherwise everything was good. Nice location. Construction around the property.  Could be noisy during the day although I left early am to notice any.

We stayed here two nights in May, 2016.  We wanted to be near Laguna Beach, but out of the madness of the beach area.  This is a business travel hotel and most of the guests fit that category, which is a good thing.  The few families here stood out and were a bother to the rest of us.  The rooms are large, nicely furnished.  Linens and towels are upscale.  This is a new property, so everything still has that nice, new hotel sheen.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The evening social hour was nice.  The breakfasts were good.  This isn't a five star hotel or resort, but for the price, I would say this was just about perfect.  Only negative would be the complex traffic pattern you have to navigate to get here and the toll road that is really the only convenient access.

There was confusion on what type of room was available. The hotel wanted to place my family of four in a one King bed studio. When I asked for a different room I was told that since I did not pay for the room and used points I should take whatever they gave me!  I will not stay at a Homewood Suites in the future.

This is an excellent hotel. Very new. Comfy clean rooms. Good free breakfast and a terrific happy hour with great food. Couple of times my dinner was the salad bar and a glass of wine. The outdoor area with the fire is very relaxing. Will definitely stay here for future business trips.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel for Business and Leisure
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for two weeks on a business trip. Selected this hotel because of proximity to my office and also being a Hhonor member. It is a very new property. The room  consists of a small kitchen with all appliances and utensils, It has a study area and comfortable bed. Surprisingly there is a fan in the room. Only thing which I have a difficulty that the maximum temperature that can be set in the air conditioner is 24 degree centigrade. I am extremely happy with this hotel and will definitely recommend for your stay.

The hotel was beautiful and clean, and the breakfast was yummy. We had a great view of the mountains.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again.  I loved that the hotel was new, and thought it was awesome they had really nice big shower instead of a tub.

Like being home. With the kitchen ,grill, pool table, and stores, Resturant ,markets and theater was very convenient . This will be my family and I 's best go to hotel. The staff was very very nice and very helpful!!!!!

Summary Heading: I really wanted to give this 5 stars, but...
Summary: I had just a few picky issues. They're probably only issue to me, but compared to what I've experienced it could be so much more. The hotel has only been open a few months, so everything is clean. I didn't need to sanitize the room as much as I usually do, no stains on any of the bedding or pillows, no random loose hairs found, etc. Stayed here due to how close it was to a wedding I was going to nearby. Here are my issues with this property: only 40 channels on the TV and all on East Coast time. 40 sounds like a lot, but 5 are Nickelodeon, 5 ESPN channels, one movie channel, and just basic cable channels no one cares about. The internet bandwidth is really weak. I brought my Roku and HDMI cable to watch steaming TV, but the hotel's internet is really weak it couldn't support

Very pleasant stay. We wanted a place near the beach but everything closer to the beach is pricy. We found this hotel to be perfect for us-a short drive to the beach & near-walking distance to do many shops & restaurants. The price was reasonable but most important our stay was great. Very nice accommodations.

Is all you will get from the minute you checked-in at this diamond in the rough in the midst of Aliso Viejo. Centrally located few miles from the beach minus the expensive rate.  This place is fun for the whole family.  Total relaxation.

While the Homewood Suites was hard to find initially (it's so new, it's not yet on most GPS maps) once I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised.  Parking was sufficient, and the lobby was beautifully appointed, modern and smelled lovely.   Once checked in, I made my way to the room and discovered the only difficulty during my entire stay.  The hallways feature confusing and misleading signage. After a few detours, I arrived at my room and was blown away by the accommodations. The decor was wonderfully modern and colorful.  The couch and chair were comfy and the combination coffee table and footrest was delightfully utilitarian.  The bathroom was spacious and the shower (no superfluous tub) was the best I've ever seen in a hotel.   The suite also featured a desk and a small kitchen

The staff I encountered were all professional, pleasant, and accommodating. When I checked in, I was giving a list with all of the eating places nearby. The rooms were nice, clean, and modern. The one bedroom suite I stayed in was beautifully decorated.  In the kitchen, there is a full size fridge, microwave, burners on the stove top, cabinets, dishes, table, etc. The living room was separated from the bedroom. There was a tv in both the living room and the bedroom. I was able to easily to hook up my roku in the living room, so that I can watch netflix and hulu. The bed was comfortable. I didn't have any problems with the complimentary wi-fi. The complimentary breakfast was decent. There was: fruit, bread for toast, pastries, eggs, ham, tater tots, cereal, waffle mix to make hot

Great stay again and the people are as great if not better than the first time. From the staff at the front desk, Matt, Hector, Lauren, Martha in Sales etc.. to Elsa, Javier, Natalie at the social hour and breakfast to everyone in between. Great experience and everyone went out of their way to make my experience a great one. Would recommend 100% to anyone.

I was very impressed with this hotel. The facility is brand new, the decor is beautiful, staff was wonderful and the complimentary breakfast was fantastic! I stayed in a suite and it was perfect for our family. We could tuck the kids into bed and still watch tv or enjoy a snack or glass of wine on the couch. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and close to beaches
Summary: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as we vacationed the coastline and LA.   The hotel is near shops, restaurants and a movie theater as well and probably most importantly, very close to freeway access and less than a 10 min drive to Laguna Beach!  Pros: - The hotel was opened in Feb 2016 and is beautiful! - The outdoor/ pool area is inviting with tons of seating.  - The rooms are spacious and because of the hotel being brand new, super clean! - The complimentary breakfast is good. They restock it to ensure there's never a short supply and offer hot items.  - During the week they offer complimentary dinner/wine and beer! - They have a small meeting space overlooking the pool area with a ton of natural light.  - There's a pool table for some indoor activity.  -

Very clean and worth the cost. Alcohol licensing wasn't complete, however conveniently located to other businesses. Customer service was right on and housekeeping was "A" game. I'd definitely visit and stay here again.

Summary Heading: Brand new Hotel Suites with great new finishes and furnishings.
Summary: Brand new Hotel Suites with great new finishes and furnishings. Very nice bathrooms and stall showers. Nice kitchen and furnishings. A bit of travel to the beach. Bar was not open when we were there as no liquor Liscence yet as brand new.

This hotel was awesome. First off, it was in a very nice part of town, and is brand new in an area that looks to be expanding. The quality of the hotel is amazing because it looks like it was just opened yesterday. Everything is in perfect condition.  The lobby, lounge area, outdoor patio are all awesome. The lounge area has huge Windows to the outdoor patio so there is a ton of light and while I typically don't care much for things like this, it really does give the hotel a much better feel. There is also a pool table in the lounge area for recreational use which I thought was a nice touch.  My room was very nice, and goes along with the theme of everything being brand new. The room was equipped with a very nice television, a ceiling fan, full kitchen, very nice bathroom, and

Very convenient, free parking, good location. Friendly staff, clean rooms and lobby. Nice pool area. Very accessible. Could use additional food available for guests, especially since it's a Homewood Suites Hotel.

This place was a month old in April.  Great location in So. Cal.  Ten minutes to nice beaches. Twenty minutes with traffic to SNA.  Way less crowded than airport or Anaheim areas.  Very casual, safe, upscale feel to the whole area.  Just a great area that won't leave you feeling run ragged from the so cal congestion that is more north.

This hotel is new to the are. Excellent staff that has excellent service. Breakfast was great. Close to freeway, major movie theater and nice restaurants. Great price. Rooms are very nice with a great layout that makes you feel like home.

Summary Heading: One of the most enjoyable stays
Summary: **I've uploaded several pictures and a video to give you a better idea of the rooms. They are all of a one bedroom suite.**  This is a very new hotel. They opened in February 2016 I think. The price was pretty good considering that Orange County is a really expensive area in general. They were working through some hiccups in terms of having enough food for breakfast, and the lighting in the living area was almost nonexistent (maybe the lights hadn't arrived), but that didn't stop this from being one of the most enjoyable hotel stays I've ever had.   As soon as you enter, you're greeted with a beautiful spacious clean lobby and an eating area behind it. The eating area is beautiful. There are plenty of tables to eat at, and there is also a pool table. The fitness room has all new

service was good.  Could only get 1 room key.  Computer wasn't working properly.  Noisy fan in bathroom, which you cannot turn off.  High pitch sound when the fan turns on to circulate air in room.  Enough about how we slept.  Facility was nice.  Breakfast was not the best, as they ran out of eggs and we needed to wait 10 minutes for them to make.  Of course, I already had my hash browns and sausage on my plate.  So they got cold.  Replace them, the ran out of those too.

This is a great location for young adults. There is lots of restaurants within walking distance and even a movie theater. Make sure you have time to eat breakfast, the croissants are very tasty and you are able to make your own waffles. They have cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, different juices.

Very friendly staff was warm & welcoming.  Hotel is fresh and new with beautiful accommodations.  Love the spacious rooms.  Hot breakfast was delicious.  Location was perfect and close to many restaurants, a movie theater and shops.  We'll definitely stay here again.

Decent stay for the price, full kitchens so bring some food. Breakfast was OK but I cook better than they do. The social hour was sans alcohol due to liquor license issues, may be corrected by now. If you are choosing based on the happy hour, call and check. I wish hotels would include notes about things that are out of order or not available during the booking process. I feel ripped off when I choose a place with specific amenities (pool, hot tub, social hour, etc.) and find out upon check in one or more of them are not working/available!

Excellent hotel and very comfortable. The only surprise I had was that no one told me about the breakfast or social hour upon check in, I had to find out by observing! On pace o found out where and what time, it was certainly a treat.  The spacious rooms are amazing. Will definitely return.

We loved the proximity to Laguna Beach.  The area and our suite were excellent.  The staff was very nice.  It was a great value, especially with the suites with a kitchenette!  The breakfast and evening social were nice amenities.  It was also only 13 miles from Disneyland.😃

New hotel. Extremely clean and modern. Comfy beds. Loved having a full kitchen with the room. Excellent staff that always greeted us when we came and went throughout our stay. Will defiantly be back!!

No hot water,  brand new hotel and no hot water, and could not fix it all day.  Means cold cold shower with limited pressure to clean.  This is labeled as a Laguna beach hotel but it is no where near the beach

Average, overpriced for the amenities rip off breakfast. Except being clean the hotel doesn't offered anything. I came with my family and my two little children for vacation, I had better expectations

Great location, great food rooms are clean, beds sleep great, and best of all Exceptional Service!!! ☆☆☆☆☆ We couldn't ask for more. My family and ate were very pleased with our stay. Job well done Homewood Suites- Aliso Viejo

My husband I decided to run away to have a Homewood Suites experience in Aliso Viejo. Indeed it was a great experience, two of the front desk agents by the name of Brett and Hector were extremely nice and helpful with getting us situated at the hotel. As for the housekeeper Gloria, she is absolutely outstanding at her job. I would have to say that she went above and beyond her call of duty with cleaning. I am definitely making another trip to this hotel ASAP it is so beautiful here. Anyone out there deciding to take a peek or even a tad bit interested in getting the Homewood suites experience should definitely give it a whirl spin :).

Well organised, clean and with lovely rooms. Large shower and lovely bathroom. Only downside is the wifi a bit slow, and not much local restaurant choice, otherwise would certainly come back again. Value for money pretty good too.

This is a new hotel, I think it has been open for less than 2 weeks so everything is in perfect condition. While I enjoyed the fact that the place is new, what made me feel at home was the staff, Matt and Lauren at the front desk, Elsa and Javier at the social, Steve and Martha in sales etc..  They along with others whose names I do not remember made us feel at home while away from home. Thanks gang, we will be back soon

Stopped on a Friday night quite late after staying at work too late, and not wanting to drive home 100 miles. They nice folks here found me a room. I ended up with a one bedroom suite. It was more room than I needed, but it was quite perfect. I liked not being in the same room as the kitchen. Room had a Full kitchen -with dishes, etc. including 2 burner stove, dishwasher, sink, microwave, and full size fridge, dining table. Living room had a sofa (sleeper, I assume), coffee table and Tv. Bedroom had a desk, dresser, beds and tables and another tv. Everything was decorated nicely and well appointed. I arrived too late to comment on the happy hour/light dinner. Breakfast was good. Scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, fresh waffles, Danish, breads, cereal, etc. Service here is the

This hotel was perfect for me !  Close to a lot of local businesses !! Close to plenty of restaurants and shopping. What more can you ask for free parking, free breakfast, lite dinner weekly and suites with plenty of room. Fully functional kitchen !
